name: Aardvark
fun_fact: Aardvarks use their long tongues to eat up to 50,000 ants and termites a night!

name: Albatross
fun_fact: Albatrosses can fly for hours without flapping their wings!

name: Alligator
fun_fact: Alligators have been around since the time of dinosaurs!

name: Antelope
fun_fact: Antelopes can run as fast as 60 mph to escape predators!

name: Armadillo
fun_fact: Armadillos can roll up into a ball to protect themselves from predators!

name: Baboon
fun_fact: Baboons use over 30 different vocalizations to communicate!

name: Bald Eagle
fun_fact: Bald eagles can see four times better than humans!

name: Barracuda
fun_fact: Barracudas are known for their speed and sharp teeth!

name: Bison
fun_fact: Bison can run up to 35 mph despite their large size!

name: Blue Whale
fun_fact: The blue whale is the largest animal to have ever lived on Earth!

name: Cheetah
fun_fact: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, reaching speeds of 70 mph!

name: Chimpanzee
fun_fact: Chimpanzees share about 98% of their DNA with humans!

name: Cobra
fun_fact: Cobras can raise their heads and spread their hoods to scare predators!

name: Cougar
fun_fact: Cougars can jump up to 20 feet in a single bound!

name: Crocodile
fun_fact: Crocodiles have the strongest bite force of any animal!

name: Dingo
fun_fact: Dingoes are wild dogs native to Australia!

name: Dolphin
fun_fact: Dolphins are highly intelligent and can recognize themselves in mirrors!

name: Dragonfly
fun_fact: Dragonflies can move each of their wings independently!

name: Duck
fun_fact: Ducks have waterproof feathers!

name: Eagle
fun_fact: Eagles have powerful talons that help them catch prey!

name: Echidna
fun_fact: Echidnas lay eggs even though they are mammals!

name: Elephant
fun_fact: Elephants have the largest brains of any land animal!

name: Emu
fun_fact: Emus are flightless birds but can run very fast!

name: Falcon
fun_fact: The peregrine falcon is the fastest bird, reaching speeds over 240 mph!

name: Fennec Fox
fun_fact: Fennec foxes have large ears that help them stay cool in the desert!

name: Giraffe
fun_fact: Giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae as humans – just seven!

name: Gorilla
fun_fact: Gorillas share about 98% of their DNA with humans!

name: Gecko
fun_fact: Geckos can stick to almost any surface, even glass, due to special toe pads!

name: Goose
fun_fact: Geese fly in a V-formation to conserve energy during migration.

name: Guppy
fun_fact: Guppies are known for their vibrant colors and ability to reproduce rapidly.

name: Hawk
fun_fact: Hawks have incredible vision, capable of spotting prey from great distances.

name: Hippopotamus
fun_fact: Hippos can hold their breath underwater for up to five minutes.

name: Honeybee
fun_fact: Honeybees communicate by dancing to show where food is located.

name: Horse
fun_fact: Horses can sleep both standing up and lying down.

name: Hyena
fun_fact: Hyenas are known for their unique 'laugh,' which is actually a form of communication.

name: Iguana
fun_fact: Iguanas have a third 'parietal' eye on top of their head to detect predators.

name: Indian Cobra
fun_fact: The Indian Cobra is famous for its ability to 'hood up' when threatened.

name: Indian Star Tortoise
fun_fact: Indian Star Tortoises have unique star-like patterns on their shells.

name: Indian Peafowl
fun_fact: Male peafowls display stunning feather fans to attract mates.

name: Jackal
fun_fact: Jackals are highly adaptable and can survive in diverse habitats.

name: Jaguar
fun_fact: Jaguars have the strongest bite force of all big cats.

name: Jellyfish
fun_fact: Some species of jellyfish are biologically immortal!

name: Kangaroo
fun_fact: Kangaroos can’t walk backward due to their muscular tails.

name: Koala
fun_fact: Koalas sleep for up to 20 hours a day!

name: Komodo Dragon
fun_fact: Komodo dragons have venomous bites that help them hunt their prey.

name: Kingfisher
fun_fact: Kingfishers have excellent vision and can see underwater.

name: Lion
fun_fact: Lions are the only cats that live in groups called prides.

name: Leopard
fun_fact: Leopards can carry prey twice their weight up a tree to avoid scavengers.

name: Lynx
fun_fact: Lynxes have excellent night vision, which helps them hunt in the dark.

name: Lemur
fun_fact: Lemurs communicate using scents and unique vocalizations.

name: Macaw
fun_fact: Macaws can mimic human speech and live up to 50 years.

name: Manatee
fun_fact: Manatees are known as 'sea cows' because they graze on underwater plants.

name: Meerkat
fun_fact: Meerkats work together in groups, taking turns as lookouts for predators.

name: Moose
fun_fact: Moose can close their nostrils to keep water out when swimming.

name: Numbat
fun_fact: Numbats eat up to 20,000 termites a day using their long tongues.

name: Narwhal
fun_fact: Narwhals are known as the 'unicorns of the sea' because of their long, spiral tusk.

name: Newt
fun_fact: Newts can regenerate lost limbs, tails, and even parts of their heart!

name: Ocelot
fun_fact: Ocelots have unique fur patterns, making them almost impossible to spot in the wild.

name: Orangutan
fun_fact: Orangutans are highly intelligent and can use tools to gather food.

name: Otter
fun_fact: Otters hold hands while sleeping to stay together and avoid drifting away.

name: Panda
fun_fact: Pandas eat almost exclusively bamboo, consuming up to 40 pounds a day.

name: Penguin
fun_fact: Penguins can drink seawater because they have a special gland to filter out salt.

name: Porcupine
fun_fact: Porcupines have around 30,000 quills that they use for self-defense.

name: Quokka
fun_fact: Quokkas are known as the 'happiest animals' because they always appear to be smiling.
